huffman

Class HuffmanEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffman.HuffmanEncoder

  • public class HuffmanEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    The HuffmanEncoder class is a Singleton factory that produces Huffman Trees for Unicode character data.
    Author:
    aarongaba

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static HuffmanEncoder encoder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private HuffmanInternalNode buildTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
      Given a multi-character alphabet, we run the standard version of the Huffman encoding algorithm to build a full-fledge (or non-trivial) Huffman tree.
      private HuffmanInternalNode buildTrivialTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
      Given a single-character alphabet, we run a special simplified version of the Huffman encoding algorithm to build this trivial tree.
      private HuffmanInternalNode constructTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
      The parent method that constructs a Huffman Tree using the appropriate algorithm, which depends upon the length of the alphabet that we are encoding.
      HuffmanInternalNode encodeData(java.io.BufferedReader sourceData)
      Constructs a Huffman tree for the data contained in a non-empty character stream.
      HuffmanInternalNode encodeData(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
      Constructs a Huffman tree for a given (non-empty) alphabet with frequencies associated with each character.
      private com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> getCharFrequencies(java.io.BufferedReader sourceData)
      Constructs a Multiset comprising of this character data's alphabet and associated with each character is its frequency in the data.
      static HuffmanEncoder getEncoder()
      Static 'instance' method
      private void verifyValidAlphabet(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
      Verifies that the Multiset representing an alphabet and its character frequencies is non-null and non-empty (i.e., contains at least one element).

                               throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a Huffman tree for the data contained in a non-empty character stream.
        Parameters:
        sourceData - - The character stream that we wish to encode
        Returns:
        huffTree - A HuffmanInternalNode that marks the root node of the constructed Huffman tree.
        Throws:
        IOException, - IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • encodeData

        public HuffmanInternalNode encodeData(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
        Constructs a Huffman tree for a given (non-empty) alphabet with frequencies associated with each character.
        Parameters:
        characterCounts - - A Multiset holding an alphabet to be encoded, along with the frequencies of each letter.
        Returns:
        huffTree - A HuffmanInternalNode that marks the root node of the constructed Huffman tree.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • verifyValidAlphabet

        private void verifyValidAlphabet(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
        Verifies that the Multiset representing an alphabet and its character frequencies is non-null and non-empty (i.e., contains at least one element).
        Parameters:
        characterCounts -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If invalid alphabet, this exception is thrown.

      • constructTree

        private HuffmanInternalNode constructTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
        The parent method that constructs a Huffman Tree using the appropriate algorithm, which depends upon the length of the alphabet that we are encoding.
        Parameters:
        characterCounts -
        Returns:
        constructedTree - A HuffmanInternalNode that marks the root node of the constructed Huffman tree.

      • buildTrivialTree

        private HuffmanInternalNode buildTrivialTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
        Given a single-character alphabet, we run a special simplified version of the Huffman encoding algorithm to build this trivial tree.
        Parameters:
        characterCounts -
        Returns:
        - A HuffmanInternalNode that marks the root node of the constructed Huffman tree.

      • buildTree

        private HuffmanInternalNode buildTree(com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> characterCounts)
        Given a multi-character alphabet, we run the standard version of the Huffman encoding algorithm to build a full-fledge (or non-trivial) Huffman tree.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A HuffmanInternalNode that marks the root node of the constructed Huffman tree.

      • getCharFrequencies

        private com.google.common.collect.Multiset<java.lang.Character> getCharFrequencies(java.io.BufferedReader sourceData)
                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a Multiset comprising of this character data's alphabet and associated with each character is its frequency in the data. Ex. "aaabbbbcc" becomes [('a',3),('b',4),('c',2)]
        Parameters:
        sourceData -
        Returns:
        charCounts
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
